thread.title: Man rescued from dam on Charlotte Bay, NSW property had been crying for help for hours
thread.title_full: Man rescued from dam on Charlotte Bay, NSW property had been crying for help for hours | Daily Telegraph

author: Megan Palin
title: Man rescued from dam on Charlotte Bay, NSW property had been crying for help for hours
text:
A MAN was up to his nose in water after his excavator rolled into a dam and trapped him there for two hours on the NSW north coast.
Westpac Rescue Helicopter air crewman Graham Nickisson told news.com.au that Daniel Miller, 45, was excavating on his property at Charlotte Bay when his whole world turned upside down.
“His excavator slid sideways into a small dam and he was trapped with his airways or nose or mouth just above the water,” Mr Nickisson said.
“I believe he was there for two hours before his neighbours heard his calls for help.”
media_camera The excavator being removed from the dam. Picture: Facebook/ Fire and Rescue 295 Forster media_camera The man was pinned by the excavator. Picture: Facebook/ Fire and Rescue 295 Forster
Chief Inspector Neil Stephens said Mr Miller was extremely lucky to survive.
“Only a part of his nose and face was above water,” he told Nine news.
Steve Howard, from Fire and Rescue NSW, said it was Mr Miller’s will power that helped him survive.
“I don’t know how he’s done it, obviously it was his willpower to live,” he told Nine news.
Mr Miller screamed for help between breaths.
A neighbour who heard his cries alerted emergency services around 2.40pm.
The Rural Fire Service pumped out water from the dam so the driver could be released.
“It was a small dam so they could lower the water level, thank God,” Mr Nickisson said.
A NSW Ambulance spokesman told news.com.au the man was treated for back pain and hypothermia.
“He sustained minor injuries,” the spokesman said.
The driver was transported to John Hunter Hospital in Newcastle where remains in a stable condition.
Originally published as ‘It was his willpower to survive’
